>>>>> "Tracy" == Tracy R Reed <treed-yahoo@...> writes:

    Tracy> After 9 years of dealing with cookies (since RFC 2109 from 1997) I think
    Tracy> the problems with cookies are well understood. There isn't
    Tracy> much point in compiling a list of problems with cookies and
    Tracy> then preaching to the choir about it, especially when there
    Tracy> is no workable alternative to cookies. My recent thread
    Tracy> "Can ReST replace cookies?" showed me that until someone
    Tracy> pushes through an RFC which implements the needed changes
    Tracy> in HTTP (for example HTTP auth which can be done in the
    Tracy> webpage like traditional cookie auth plus logout ability or
    Tracy> something even better) and gets it implemented in the
    Tracy> browsers we are simply screwed in this area.

Authentication? Here:

  http://www.berenddeboer.net/rest/authentication.html

Personalised logon forms? Here:

  http://www.peej.co.uk/articles/http-auth-with-html-forms.html

-- 
Regards,

Berend. (-:
